intro: Cyrtocarpa kruseana, commonly known as the rock fig, is a small evergreen shrub native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Moraceae, which includes figs and related plants. The plant is characterized by its glossy, oval-shaped leaves and small, clustered greenish-white flowers. Its fruit is a small, smooth, yellowish drupe that ripens in late summer. It thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is often found in coastal and mountainous regions.
